result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Global P/S did not happen.  Now to be set for JT.
filed by Atty Borsheim requesting global plea/sentencing hearing

10:01 AM Defendant Carl L Sparks in court, in custody.  Attorney Allison J Borsheim in court for Carl L Sparks.  Attorney Peggy A. Crooks-Mishacoff in court for State of Wisconsin. Information filed, reading waived. Defendant stood mute. Court entered not guilty plea, jury trial to be set. Bond continued. This will be set for 1 day trial. 10:02 AM
copy of discovery material filed by Atty Crooks-Mishacoff to Atty Borsheim

3:10 PM Prosecuting attorney Peggy Crooks-Mishacoff appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Carl L Sparks in court, in custody.  Attorney Allison J Borsheim in court for Carl L Sparks. State called witness, Deputy Jesse Sprague of Portage Police Department, sworn. Direct exam. Cross exam. Redirect. Witness excused. Closing arguments. Court found probable cause, bound the defendant over for further proceedings.
Arraignment scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 10:00 am.
